file_content.text: I must prepare. Leave me.
I will remember your defiance. Countless worlds will suffer for it.
Stop. We must speak.
The Burning Way still churns with liquid fire. Gore Claw has failed me.
You have stalled my return. You have much power, but you could have more.
Save it. I didn't come all this way to chat.
I'm here to stop you.
Your defiance is admirable, but unnecessary.
You're right. I am powerful.
The Esh-kha do not die easily. Your victory over them does you credit.
All right, you've got my attention. Start talking.
I'm listening.
You need not fear my hunger. Many cycles will pass before my roots burrow into this planet and crack it open.
I will be free, but you will be dust and bones by then. Aid me, and your rewards will be great.
I don't strike deals with planet-killing monsters.
Not interested.
A Jedi has no need for personal gain.
You're wasting your breath.
Protecting the galaxy from monsters like you is its own reward.
You can't bribe me.
You can't put a price on a grateful Republic. Well, maybe I can....
Hmm. Really probably not....
You do not yet know the extent of my generosity. There is much you could gain.
I fail to see how dooming the galaxy works in my favor.
I don't buy it.
My escape is inevitable. This tomb cannot hold me forever. Take what recompense you can.
What kind of rewards are we talking here?
Like what?
The long-lost technology of your predecessors.
Surely you know the glory of the Builders and their Infinite Empire. The fury of their weapons surpassed even my own might.
Destroy the Burning Way. Seal the vents so I may begin my escape, and the Builders' technology is yours. Refuse, and your children's children shall know my wrath.
I came here to activate the Burning Way, not destroy it. And on that note....
I'll never help you.
This is far from over. When I am free, I will obliterate every planet you have ever seen or known.
I have waited thousands of years for my freedom. I can wait thousands more. You will regret this.
All right, but you better keep your end of the bargain.
Fine, it's a deal.
The way has been cleared. My return is decided. You have chosen wisely.
Now your reward. On the ice world of Ilum, a small cluster of my worshipers remains. There you will find the Builders' technology.
Now go. My hunger grows. This world will not satiate me.
